summary: A configuration holder for Dense Passage Retrieval (DPR) models, encapsulating all architectural hyper‑parameters such as vocabulary size, hidden dimensions, number of layers, attention heads, dropout rates, position‑embedding type, and optional projection size. It inherits from a BERT configuration base and is used to instantiate DPR context encoders, question encoders, or readers with either default settings matching the reference model or user‑specified values.
business_intent: Enable developers to conveniently define and customize the architecture of DPR components for retrieval‑augmented tasks (e.g., open‑domain question answering) without manually handling low‑level model parameters.
